resource.chars:
[paragraph]. 31. the tentacles of the fringe of <u>Rhizostoma<\u> and <u>Cephea<\u>  have 
already been described ([paragraph]13.) the tentacles which beset the 
generative membrane closely resemble them and consist of a 
single membrane containing many small thread cells 1/4000<sup>th<\sup> in 
in diameter - their cavity is filled with a homogeneous 
substance sometimes containing nuclei similar to those of 
the disc ([paragraph]15.), the inner membrane takes no part in their 
formation. (Fig.30) 
[paragraph].32. the marginal tentacles of <u>Thaumantias<\u> are very similar 
(Fig 3) to the buccal tentacles of <u>Mesonema<\u> - they consist of an outer 
membrane in which numbers of thread cells are imbedded and 
an inner axis composed of clear cells arranged end to end - they 
have a peculiarity which has ben already pointed out by 
Prof. Ed. Forbes in being placed above the marginal <s>tentacle<\s> 
vesicles instead of being alternate with them as in the nearly 
allied genus <u>Geryonia<\u>, and from this fact and <s<their<\s> from 
their totally different structure I believe that they have 
a totally different origin - In <u>Geryonia<\u> the tentacles belong 
to the second class - are processes of the circular canal; in 
<u>Thaumantias<\u> they are simple processes of the outer foundation 
membrane - i.e. of the substance of the disc - Perhaps his difference 
in structure among the tentacles may turn out to be a good 
means of generic distinction among other members of the class. 
[paragraph]. 33. As to the second class of tentacles. Such are the marginal 
tentacles of <u>Mesonema<\u> - of <u>Geryonia<\u> (Will) of <u>Oceania<\u>, & 
of <u>Medusa Aurita<\u> (Ehrenberg); the tentacles of the under 
surface of <u>Phacellophora<\u> and the interbrachial tentacles of <u>Cephea<\u> 
10
